intro: Thesium pyrenaicum subsp. grandiflorum, commonly known as the Pyrenean thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences bearing yellowish-green flowers with three petals. It is native to the Pyrenees region and thrives in alpine or subalpine habitats. Thesium pyrenaicum subsp. grandiflorum is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
